main event: A civilian reported sighting a shaft of light in the sky at regular intervals during a one-hour period at night in Augusta, Kentucky on July 26, 1949.
interesting points: The observer noted a similarity between the reported phenomenon and the appearance of a searchlight beam often used at carnivals, fairs, and public gatherings.
The communication to the Headquarters expressed a wish for the observed 'lightning in the sky' to be natural lights, indicating a genuine curiosity about the phenomenon.
The handwritten page mentions the possibility of the observed lights being similar to the 'bomb Wright field,' suggesting a reference to experimental aircraft or military activity.
The location of the sighting was 45 miles up the Ohio river from Cincinnati, adding geographical context to the report.

The reported sighting took place during the post-World War II period, a time of significant technological advancements and military activities, potentially influencing perceptions of unidentified aerial phenomena.
sighted object: shaft of light in the sky
